p: In December 2019, a series of acute respiratory illness cases with unknown etiology has been reported in Wuhan, China [ 9]. On January 7, 2020, Chinese authorities confirmed that the causative agent was a novel coronavirus and officially named it the coronavirus disease 2019 COVID-19, and the virus was scientifically named SARS-CoV-2, which was declared later on as a world pandemic. As of May 4, 2020, the virus has infected nearly 3,582,233 patients, including 248,558 who have died. Even though the Chinese government has successfully contained the outbreak, the virus keeps spreading elsewhere in the world, putting the international community on alert that the worst scenarios are possible.
